title: Revert site content back to original Sweta romantic version

requirements.text: Revert the website content in `frontend/src/App.tsx` to the original Sweta romantic version (i.e., keep/restore the recipient name as “Sweta”, keep the romantic relationship framing, and keep/restore the story occasion/date as “29 November”), ensuring no remaining text reflects the alternative “Kavya ji”, “Rose Day”, or friendship-only rewrite.

quotes: nhi pehla jasie he kar do sweta wala

acceptanceCriteria: All visible user-facing text in `frontend/src/App.tsx` refers to the recipient as “Sweta” (not “Kavya ji”).
The story section references “29 November” (not “Rose Day”).
Section titles and letter/signature are in the romantic version (e.g., titles like “Our Love Story”, romantic phrasing, and boyfriend/romantic signature if present in the original).
All relevant image `alt` text in `frontend/src/App.tsx` uses “Sweta” where a person-name is used, and does not mention “Kavya ji”.

constraints: Do not edit files under `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts` / `frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx`, `frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts`, `frontend/src/main.tsx`, or anything in `frontend/src/components/ui` (compose instead of modifying).
Backend must remain single-actor in `backend/main.mo`; only add `backend/migration.mo` if a state upgrade is required (not expected for this change).
nonGoals: Do not introduce new backend functionality or persistence.
Do not rename or regenerate existing image files unless explicitly required; only adjust UI text/alt text as needed.
